title: IP Address Checker has been released
body: We have released a function that allows you to check the IP address of the browsing user. We do not collect the IP address, so please use it with confidence because we only keep the previous record in the local storage. The internal configuration is as follows. It can be used from the following. [IP Address Checker] (https://portal.kemu.site/tools/userinfo) This time again, I used Route53's alias A record, but it seems that two A records are automatically created if specified in alias. For more information about alias A records, please refer to [Click here] (https://portal.kemu.site/blog/1175617296). `` `zsh $ DIG API.KEMU.SITE ; << >> Dig 9.10.6 << >> API.KEMU.SITE ;; Global Options: +CMD ;; Got Answer: ;; - >> Header << -Opcode: Query, Status: NOERROR, ID: 56004 ;; Flags: QR RD Ra; Query: 1, Answer: 2, Authority: 0, Additional: 1 ;; Opt Pseudosection: ; EDNS: Version: 0, Flags :; UDP: 512 ;; Question Section: ; API.KEMU.SITE. in a ;; Answer Section: API.KEMU.SITE. 60 in a 54.168.114.234 API.KEMU.SITE. 60 in a 13.112.219.250 ;; Query Time: 100 Msec ;; Server: 2404: 1a8: 7f01: b :: 3#53 (2404: 1a8: 7f01: b: 3) ;; When: Tue Mar 22 21:58:08 JST 2022 ;; MSG Size RCVD: 74 `` ` * When using API Gateway, it seems that the IP direct phosphorus is being played, so it is convenient because you do not have to prepare WAF.
